content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE; TABLE OF CONTENTS." is a condensed summary of the section title and table of contents. The Export-Import Bank Reauthorization Act of 1997 includes provisions such as extension of authority, tied aid credit fund authority, clarification of procedures for denying credit based on national interest, administrative counsel, advisory committee for sub-Saharan Africa, increase in labor representation on the Export-Import Bank's Advisory Committee, outreach to companies, and clarification of the bank's objectives. It also includes child labor as a criterion for denying credit based on national interest. Prohibition on Russian transfers of certain missiles to China in the national interest. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to extend authority until September 30, 2001. The amendment will take effect on September 30, 1997. Additionally, there is tied aid credit fund authority. Section 10(c)(2) of the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to remove certain provisions. Section 10(e) is also amended to authorize necessary appropriations for the Fund. Public Law 103-428 is amended to extend authority for financing nonlethal defense articles or services. Procedures for denying credit based on national interest are clarified in Section 2(b)(1)(B) of the Act. Section 2(b)(1)(B) of the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to require consultation with specific committees before making determinations on credit applications in the national interest. The determinations must be delivered in writing to the Bank's President and specify which applications should be denied. SEC. 6. ADMINISTRATIVE COUNSEL. Amendment to the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 to designate an Assistant General Counsel for Administration to provide legal counsel on personnel and administrative law matters. SEC. 7. ADVISORY COMMITTEE FOR SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to promote the expansion of the Bank's financial commitments in sub-Saharan Africa. An advisory committee will advise on policies to support this expansion and facilitate greater trade support by U.S. commercial banks. The advisory committee will terminate after 4 years. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to increase labor representation on the advisory committee. At least 2 members appointed to the committee must be from the labor community. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to increase labor representation on the advisory committee. The committee must have representatives from the labor community, with a requirement that no 2 representatives can be from the same labor union. SEC. 9. OUTREACH TO COMPANIES. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to enhance outreach efforts to small and rural companies. The objectives of the Export-Import Bank are clarified to include a commitment to reinvestment, job creation, and the development of productive resources in the United States. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to include child labor as a criterion for denying credit based on national interest. Additionally, a prohibition is added regarding Russian transfers of certain missile systems to China. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to include child labor as a criterion for denying credit based on national interest. A prohibition is added for Russian transfers of specific missile systems to China, requiring notification to the Bank if deemed a threat to US security.
